summary: "Dookie," Green Day's third album, came out in 1994 and was their big break. It was their first with producer Rob Cavallo and was recorded in California. The songs, mainly written by Billie Joe Armstrong, talk about real-life stuff like boredom and relationships. Singles like "Basket Case" and "Longview" made it a huge success, giving the band worldwide fame. The album won a Grammy and sold over 20 million copies, making it one of the best-selling albums ever. It's often called one of the best punk rock albums and was added to the National Recording Registry in 2024.
title: Dookie
